channel.title: Kick drums - need help!
channel.description:
hey guys. I have been trying to make my kick drums work more fluidly in my song and i always run into the same issues with making the drum sound more natural in the track.
If anyone has a good list of which sample packs have the best kick drums, and what types of songs to use them on - i would be forever grateful.
thanks :)

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
Play a kick sample.
For me, when I tune the sample, I listen to what pitch is dominant at the beginning, middle, and end. I tune that sample based on the key the project’s in so that the dominant pitch is the same as the key.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

Tuning the kick is important

That’s what I do to make the drum kick have more sub-bass.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Nice, this was a great example… it’s amazing how the first four bars when he does the A/B just gel so much better. It’s subtle, to me, but it does bring a clarity to the mix for sure

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: Vveerrgg
item.description:
An oldschool techno trick is to mix a short kick with a softer longer kick and swap out one or the other in parts of the track where you want to change the energy of the tune without losing the kick.

I do if ALL the time to keep the tracks dynamic without much effort /double and triple up your kick and move between them.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
That’s interesting, because the observed behavior of the kicks that do in fact tune to key seem to tune directly to the key and not to the 5th. I could be wrong though. Probably should stop talking about things I know nothing about.

[Edit: I actually tried to send this via e-mail about 4 hours ago and it just now left my outbox, guess my phone was having some issues]

Read full topic

item.description:
Awesome thanks man, gonna give it a go on Monday

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
iammane:

Is there some sort of method to this?

Check out this tutorial by Hannes Bieger:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/aJycZ4zVYu4

If you have apeMatrix (which you do), then you can do everything he covers in the video using the three different modes (Scope/XY/Spectral) of the built-in oscilloscope .

iammane:

It’s something I always wanted to give a go but I know I don’t have the ear for it.

Even if you don’t have the fancy tools, you’d be surprised how far you can get with just your ears.
If you slowly sweep the tuning and pitch controls, you’ll often find a sweet spot.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: Zeph
item.description:
Kicks tune to the closest 5th or 1st of the key. It doesn’t tune to the first everytime. And as far as I have been informed, this applies to all native samples.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Tuning the kick is important.

For the record, all the OG kicks tune to the project’s preset key, along with all the kicks in Leviathan 2 (aside from the 808 kicks). Anything else you have to do manually, which is tricky as Auxy doesn’t natively display the key of samples. But as a rule of thumb, a good way to check is to just stick with one of the leviathan 2 kicks as they do tune. (The snares do the same as well)

Read full topic

item.title: Kick drums - need help!
item.dc:creator: Tolberto
item.description:
Take off some lowpass. Some of the high end of the drums sound unnatural for some genres
